name: Gob
descriptions: Gob, full name Gobtholemew, is an abused ghoul bartender who works at Moriarty's Saloon in Megaton in the year 2277.

Treated as a freakish, second-class citizen by many people in Megaton (particularly Colin Moriarty), Gob is skittish and nervous, always looking over his shoulder. He does his best to maintain a sense of humor and to be friendly with customers, but this is mostly out of his desire not to be beaten. Confessor Cromwell and Mother Maya treat Gob with respect and an air of reverence because of their spiritual beliefs.

Gob used to live in Underworld with his adoptive mother, Carol, in Carol's Place. He set out into the wasteland to find fortune and was caught by a group of slavers. Colin Moriarty then purchased him as his slave. He works for Colin Moriarty to repay the debt presumably incurred when Moriarty purchased Gob from the slavers. Gob has been working to repay his debt for 15 years, since Moriarty also charges Gob for rent and food.

Gob spends most of his time serving drinks and talking with the patrons in Moriarty's saloon. At night, he'll eventually go to sleep in the rentable room, sometimes resting for a few hours and then starting up the saloon in the early morning hours. During his working hours, he'll be cleaning glasses, communicating with people ("What, you never seen a ghoul before?"), tidying up the place with a dirty broom and checking the shelves behind the counter to see what's currently in stock. The first time the Lone Wanderer enters the saloon, Gob will be hitting the radio, trying to fix it. Nova tries to explain to him it doesn't work, and Jericho (if he is present) will curse at him to stop banging on it. Also, if Walter is present he will remark to Gob to stop hitting the radio as he finds the Enclave radio "downright patriotic," even though Enclave radio is not playing. After the player completes the Galaxy News Radio quest, the radio will function properly, though Gob will never comment on its improvement.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Don't shoot! Please! Just tell me what you want!{Nervous. Very nervous. Used to be treated like crap.}

topics.topic_text: What's all this about Galaxy News Radio?
topics.response_text: Mister Moriarty says we can keep it on. It's a good radio station.

topics.topic_text: I talked to Moriarty already and he's trying to charge me for the info.
topics.response_text: Sigh. That's his way. Always putting caps before people's lives.

topics.topic_text: Gob, please. If you know anything about my father, you need to tell me.
topics.response_text: I was like you once. I wandered into town looking for an escape from this stupid joke of a body I'm trapped in. Now look at me.

topics.topic_text: Look, you rotting piece of shit! Tell me what you know or it's splatter time!
topics.response_text: All right! I'll tell you! Please, just don't hurt me!

topics.topic_text: Look, if you know something, you'd better tell me!
topics.response_text: Look, smoothskin. I've told you all I dare. Moriarty doesn't like me chatting with the customers like this.

topics.topic_text: If you know anyone else that can help, I'd appreciate it.
topics.response_text: Moriarty is your best bet. I wish you luck. Now, I have to get back to work, or I'll be answering to him too.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Moriarty's terminal?
topics.response_text: I hate that fucking thing. It's all he cares about.

topics.topic_text: I really need to get into that terminal.
topics.response_text: Oh, Mister Moriarty never lets me back there.

topics.topic_text: I'm sick of this shit. Help me get into the terminal so I can find what I need!
topics.response_text: No! Please! Don't hit me!

topics.topic_text: All right, thanks.
topics.response_text: Sure thing.

topics.topic_text: I need a drink.
topics.response_text: Yeah. Enjoy. Dick ...

topics.topic_text: Gah! Fuck! What are you?
topics.response_text: I guess they don't have a lot of Ghouls in the Vault.

topics.topic_text: No. What's a ghoul?
topics.response_text: Well, not all of us got the chance to hole up in a nice cushy Vault when the bombs fell.

topics.topic_text: You know, it's not so bad.
topics.response_text: Nice of you to say so. If you can't be nice, at least pretend, right? Fake it 'till you make it, and all that.

topics.topic_text: That's disgusting.
topics.response_text: Yeah, fuck you too. Whatever, man. I'm used to being treated like shit around here.

topics.topic_text: I know what a Ghoul is. Now get away from me, zombie.
topics.response_text: Yeah... great. What do you need? ... asshole ...{Disappointed and returning to being nervous. "asshole" is said under his breath}

topics.topic_text: I've got nothing against you people.
topics.response_text: Well now. That's a surprise! I'm used to every asshole smoothskin in this town giving me shit just because I look like a corpse.

topics.topic_text: Stuff it, Ghoul. And stop looking at me.
topics.response_text: I see how it is... <sigh> What do you need?

topics.topic_text: Let me think about it for a moment, my good man.
topics.response_text: Wait... you're not going to hit me? Yell at me? Not even berate me a little bit?

topics.topic_text: Are you kidding? Me? Shut the hell up, Ghoul. I'll beat you if I feel like it.
topics.response_text: <sighs> I suppose I was wrong... should have known better.

topics.topic_text: I hadn't planned on it.
topics.response_text: Well now. That's a surprise! I'm used to every asshole smoothskin in this town giving me shit just because I look like a corpse.

topics.topic_text: Where did you come from?
topics.response_text: A place called Underworld. It's a Ghoul city down in D.C. I set off up here to find adventure and fortune. And... well... I found this place.

topics.topic_text: That's all I needed to know.
topics.response_text: Okay!

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for my father. Middle-aged guy. Maybe you've seen him?
topics.response_text: Even if I knew, I wouldn't tell you.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Sorry, smoothskin. I can't take the risk. Moriarty will beat the shit out of me for even talking to you!

conversation.response_text: I know, I know. I'll get a mop. It's just... blood is so hard to get out of the floor.{cringing and afraid he's going to get in trouble}
Aw, forget it. I guess we're stuck with this Enclave crap.
Mister Moriarty, sir! What can I do for you?
I... I think we're running low on Nuka-Cola, sir. I... I just thought you'd want to know...
Please, sir! I'm sorry! I... I'm just stupid, you know that! A stupid, rotting corpse, right? I'll take care of it, I swear!
